t2.title: Getting Started With DFST Docker
t2.desc:
The DITA for Small Teams Docker containers make it easy to set up a complete DFST
    environment on any machine using the Docker container technology.

t3.title: DFST Container Quick Start
t3.desc:
If you are familiar with Docker you can follow these instructions to get going as
    quickly as possible.
t3.keywords: dfst docker $PWD dfst dfst dfst $PATH echo dfst dfst make-gitlab-user dfst linkmgr

t4.title: Extending the DFST Docker System
t4.desc:
It is easy to extend or modify the DFST system by defining your own containers that
    build on the base containers.

t5.title: Building the DFST Containers
t5.desc:
You can use the docker-compose command to build all the DFST
    containers in one go.
t5.keywords: docker-compose docker-compose docker-compose HOSTNAME docker-compose docker-compose build

t6.title: Configuring Your Own Containers
t6.desc:
You can configure your own versions of the DFST containers through custom
    docker-compose.yml files.

t7.title: DFST Container System Description
t7.desc:
The DFST container system is composed from a set of Docker containers where each
    container provides a separate component of the complete DFST system.

t9.title: DFST System Configuration
t9.desc:
Using the DFST containers requires a little bit of configuration to reflect the details
    of where you have the containers deployed, as well as component-specific configuration that
    reflects your publication development details.

t10.title: Docker Container Reference
t10.desc:
The following Docker containers are used by the DITA for Small Teams setup documented in
    this guide.

t11.title: DFST DITA Open Toolkit Docker Container
t11.desc: The dfst/dita-ot container provides a generic DITA Open Toolkit image.

t12.title: DFST Link Manager BaseX Docker Container
t12.desc:
The dfst/link-manager-basex container provides a BaseX HTTP server configured with the
    DITA for Small Teams Link Manager application.

t13.title: DFST GitLab Docker Container
t13.desc:
The dfst/gitlab container provides a fully-featured instance of the GitLab git server
    and GitLab continous Integration (CI) server.
